bigstatsr

Scores of PCA

Get the scores of PCA associated with an svd decomposition using function big_SVD.

big_predScoresPCA(obj.svd, X = NULL, ind.test = seq(nrow(X)),
  block.size = 1000, use.Eigen = !detect_MRO())

Arguments

obj.svd
A list returned by big_SVD.
X
A big.matrix. You shouldn't have missing values in your data.
ind.test
Vector of indices of samples to be projected. Don't use negative indices here.
block.size
Maximum number of columns read at once. Default is 1000.
use.Eigen
Should the Eigen library be used for matrix computations? Default tries to detect MRO. See details.

Value

A matrix of size n * K where n is the number of samples corresponding to indices of ind.test and K the number of PCs computed in obj.svd. If X is not specified, this just returns the scores of the training set of obj.svd.

See also

predict big_SVD

Examples

# Simulating some data
X <- big.matrix(73, 43)
X[] <- rnorm(length(X))

# Using only half of the data for "training"
ind <- sort(sample(nrow(X), nrow(X)/2))

test <- big_SVD(X = X,
                 fun.scaling = big_scale(),
                 ind.train = ind)
#> (2)
str(test)
#> List of 5
#>  $ d    : num [1:35] 11.59 11.24 10.57 10 9.83 ...
#>  $ u    : num [1:36, 1:35] 0.3816 -0.4429 0.0228 -0.0665 0.2401 ...
#>  $ v    : num [1:43, 1:35] 0.0919 -0.0636 -0.0443 -0.32 -0.1158 ...
#>  $ means: num [1:43] -0.1745 -0.0985 -0.0654 -0.1593 0.0762 ...
#>  $ sds  : num [1:43] 0.871 0.923 0.961 0.926 1.062 ...

pca <- prcomp(X[ind, ], center = TRUE, scale. = TRUE)

# same scaling
print(all.equal(test$means, pca$center))
#> [1] TRUE
print(all.equal(test$sds, pca$scale))
#> [1] TRUE

# scores and loadings are the same or opposite
# except for last eigenvalue which is equal to 0
# due to centering of columns
scores <- test$u %*% diag(test$d)
scores2 <- big_predScoresPCA(test) # use this function to predict scores
print(all.equal(scores, scores2))
#> [1] TRUE
print(dim(scores))
#> [1] 36 35
print(dim(pca$x))
#> [1] 36 36
print(tail(pca$sdev))
#> [1] 4.008164e-01 3.340310e-01 3.176209e-01 1.816310e-01 1.645930e-01
#> [6] 8.697788e-16
plot(scores2, pca$x[, 1:ncol(scores2)])
plot(test$v, pca$rotation[, 1:ncol(scores2)])

# projecting on new data
X.test <- sweep(sweep(X[-ind, ], 2, test$means, '-'), 2, test$sds, '/')
scores.test <- X.test %*% test$v
ind2 <- setdiff(seq(nrow(X)), ind)
scores.test2 <- big_predScoresPCA(test, X, ind.test = ind2) # use this
print(all.equal(scores.test, scores.test2))
#> [1] TRUE
scores.test3 <- predict(pca, X[-ind, ])
plot(scores.test2, scores.test3[, 1:ncol(scores.test2)])
